segment.source: title: Setup Windows Containers in a local VM
segment.target: title: Setup Windows Containers in a local VM

segment.source: Preparing Windows Server Technical Preview for Windows Server Containers
segment.target: Preparing Windows Server Technical Preview for Windows Server Containers

segment.source: 12-Nov update.
segment.target: 12-Nov update.

segment.source: In order to create and manage Windows Server Containers, the Windows Server 2016 Technical Preview environment must be prepared.
segment.target: In order to create and manage Windows Server Containers, the Windows Server 2016 Technical Preview environment must be prepared.

segment.source: This guide will walk through configuring Windows Server Containers in a Hyper-V Virtual Machine.
segment.target: This guide will walk through configuring Windows Server Containers in a Hyper-V Virtual Machine.

segment.source: Other getting started guides:
segment.target: Other getting started guides:

segment.source: Run Windows Server Containers in Azure.
segment.target: Run Windows Server Containers in Azure.

segment.source: Run Windows Server Containers in an existing virtual machine.
segment.target: Run Windows Server Containers in an existing virtual machine.

segment.source: Setup Windows Server Containers on a physical Windows Server Core installation.
segment.target: Setup Windows Server Containers on a physical Windows Server Core installation.

segment.source: PLEASE READ PRIOR TO INSTALLING THE CONTAINER OS IMAGE: The license terms of the Microsoft Windows Server Pre-Release software (“License Terms”) apply to your use of the Microsoft Windows Container OS Image supplement (the “supplemental software).
segment.target: PLEASE READ PRIOR TO INSTALLING THE CONTAINER OS IMAGE: The license terms of the Microsoft Windows Server Pre-Release software (“License Terms”) apply to your use of the Microsoft Windows Container OS Image supplement (the “supplemental software).

segment.source: By downloading and using the supplemental software, you agree to the License Terms, and you may not use it if you have not accepted the License Terms.
segment.target: By downloading and using the supplemental software, you agree to the License Terms, and you may not use it if you have not accepted the License Terms.

segment.source: Both the Windows Server Pre-Release software and the supplemental software are licensed by Microsoft Corporation.
segment.target: Both the Windows Server Pre-Release software and the supplemental software are licensed by Microsoft Corporation.

segment.source: System running Windows 10 / Windows Server Technical Preview 2 or later.
segment.target: System running Windows 10 / Windows Server Technical Preview 2 or later.

segment.source: Hyper-V role enabled (see instructions).
segment.target: Hyper-V role enabled (see instructions).

segment.source: 20GB available storage for container host image, OS Base Image and setup scripts.
segment.target: 20GB available storage for container host image, OS Base Image and setup scripts.

segment.source: Administrator permissions on the Hyper-V host.
segment.target: Administrator permissions on the Hyper-V host.

segment.source: Windows Server Containers do not require Hyper-V however to keep things simple this guide assumes that a Hyper-V environment is being used to run the Windows Server Container host.
segment.target: Windows Server Containers do not require Hyper-V however to keep things simple this guide assumes that a Hyper-V environment is being used to run the Windows Server Container host.

segment.source: Setup a New Container Host on a New Virtual Machine
segment.target: Setup a New Container Host on a New Virtual Machine

segment.source: Windows Server Containers consist of several components such as the Windows Server Container Host and Container OS Base Image.
segment.target: Windows Server Containers consist of several components such as the Windows Server Container Host and Container OS Base Image.

segment.source: We have put together a script that will download and configure these items for you.
segment.target: We have put together a script that will download and configure these items for you.

segment.source: Follow these steps to deploy a new Hyper-V Virtual Machine and configure this system as a Windows Server Container Host.
segment.target: Follow these steps to deploy a new Hyper-V Virtual Machine and configure this system as a Windows Server Container Host.

segment.source: Start a PowerShell session as Administrator.
segment.target: Start a PowerShell session as Administrator.

segment.source: This can be done by right clicking on the PowerShell icon and selecting ‘Run as Administrator’, or by running the following command from any PowerShell session.
segment.target: This can be done by right clicking on the PowerShell icon and selecting ‘Run as Administrator’, or by running the following command from any PowerShell session.

segment.source: Use the following command to download the configuration script.
segment.target: Use the following command to download the configuration script.

segment.source: The script can also be manually downloaded from this location - Configuration Script.
segment.target: The script can also be manually downloaded from this location - Configuration Script.

segment.source: Run the following command to create and configure the container host where will be the virtual machine name and will be the password assigned to the Administrator account.
segment.target: Run the following command to create and configure the container host where will be the virtual machine name and will be the password assigned to the Administrator account.

segment.source: When the script begins you will be asked to read and accept licensing terms.
segment.target: When the script begins you will be asked to read and accept licensing terms.

segment.source: The script will then begin to download and configure the Windows Server Container components.
segment.target: The script will then begin to download and configure the Windows Server Container components.

segment.source: This process may take quite some time due to the large download.
segment.target: This process may take quite some time due to the large download.

segment.source: When finished your Virtual Machine will be configured and ready for you to create and manage Windows Server Containers and Windows Server Container Images with both PowerShell and Docker.
segment.target: When finished your Virtual Machine will be configured and ready for you to create and manage Windows Server Containers and Windows Server Container Images with both PowerShell and Docker.

segment.source: You may receive the following message during the Window Server Container host deployment process.
segment.target: You may receive the following message during the Window Server Container host deployment process.

segment.source: If you do, check the properties of the virtual machine and connect the virtual machine to a virtual switch.
segment.target: If you do, check the properties of the virtual machine and connect the virtual machine to a virtual switch.

segment.source: You can also run the following PowerShell command where is the name of the Hyper-V virtual switch that you would like to connect to the virtual machine.
segment.target: You can also run the following PowerShell command where is the name of the Hyper-V virtual switch that you would like to connect to the virtual machine.

segment.source: When the configuration script has completed, start the virtual machine.
segment.target: When the configuration script has completed, start the virtual machine.

segment.source: The VM is configured with Windows Server 2016 Core and will look like the following.
segment.target: The VM is configured with Windows Server 2016 Core and will look like the following.

segment.source: Finally log into the virtual machine using the password specified during the configuration process and make sure that the Virtual Machine has a valid IP address.
segment.target: Finally log into the virtual machine using the password specified during the configuration process and make sure that the Virtual Machine has a valid IP address.

segment.source: With these items completed your system should be ready for Windows Server Containers.
segment.target: With these items completed your system should be ready for Windows Server Containers.

segment.target: Video Walkthrough

segment.target: Next Steps - Start Using Containers

segment.target: Now that you have a Windows Server 2016 system running the Windows Server Container feature jump to the following guides to begin working with Windows Server Containers and Windows Server Container images.
